Key Match Events: Mexico equalized in the 11th minute of stoppage time
Honduras earned two red cards en route to penalties
Bryan Rochez's penalty was stopped by Luis Malagon
Edrick Menjivar stopped Cesar Huerta twice from the spot, but Huerta buried the ensuing penalty
Pre-Game Insights: Mexico needed a big result to seal automatic qualification to the Copa America
Post-Match Reflections: Mexico's Edson Alvarez was the standout midfielder and scored the goal to save Mexico's skin
Honduras fought valiantly but were unfortunate that Menjivar was called twice for popping on his line
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a wild shootout triumph for Mexico
Mexico will face Panama in the Nations League semifinals and the winner will face either the U.S. or Jamaica in the final
Honduras will have to sweat out their Copa America spot and face Costa Rica in the March international window
Others: The match was played at the Azteca stadium
Mexico's comeback was dramatic and somehow came together in the end
